page.title: 18Health Services In Alderney
page.content: Babies can be born in Alderney but most of them are sent to Guernsey. In an emergency patients are flown out by Aurigny Air Services who always keep a plane here for the purpose. There are up to 900 accidents a year and these are dealt with in casualty. There is a League of Friends who help with visiting patients. The hospital was rebuilt with help from the Nuffield Hospital Trust and H.M. Queen Elizabeth laid the foundation stone. The main worries for Alderney about the hospital concern the large number of geriatrics who occupy beds and the feasiblity of a small cottage hospital meeting the needs of modern health care. Alderney has no National Health Service so that the high cost of health care tends to fall on the States though most people have some private insurance.
